name: Intro/Wine Making
description:
Overview of the history of wine, viticulture, fermentation, winery operations,
the physiology of wine consumption, wines produced in California and other
major wine-producing regions and the sensory evaluation of wine. May be taught
abroad.

name: Abnormal Psych
description:
Descriptive and functional account of behavioral disorders, with primary
consideration given to neurotic and psychotic behavior.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience on or off campus in subject areas pertaining to plant and
environmental sciences. Internship supervised by a faculty member.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Completion of 84 units.

name: Computers in Technology
description:
Concepts of computing and applications using personal computers, spreadsheets,
database management, word processing and communications.

name: Viticultural Practices
description:
Field oriented experience in the principles and practices of grapevine
production, including vineyard establishment, vine training, trellising,
canopy management practices, irrigation and water management, and methods of
crop adjustment for improvement of fruit quality. One field trip required.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Completion of grammar sequence and continuing practice of all language skills
using cultural texts. May be taught abroad in a Spanish speaking country under
the supervision of UC Davis faculty.
prereq: SPA 002 or SPA 002S or SPA 002V or SPA 002Y

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Don Quijote II
description:
Critical interpretation of Don Quijote Part Two by Cervantes. Focused study of
key elements within the socio-cultural context of Golden Age Spain. Don
Quijote as prototype for the modern novel.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Analysis of Variance
description:
Basics of experimental design. One-way and two-way fixed effects analysis of
variance models. Randomized complete and incomplete block design. Multiple
comparisons procedures. One-way random effects model.

name: The Hindu Temple
description:
Comparative history of architecture and symbolism of the Hindu Temple in
India, Southeast Asia and the United States. Attention to the temple as
expression of religious knowledge, political authority, and cultural heritage
through the lens of colonialism and postcolonialism.

name: Crisis in Environment
description:
Explores contemporary environmental issues by examining the causes, effects
and solutions to a wide range of environmental problems facing the global
ecosystem. Integrated discussion of political, societal and economic impact
linkages with environmental problems. May be taught abroad.

name: Buddhism
Latin Amer Great Works
description:
Study of major works of Latin American literature/culture and their cultural
and literary milieus. May include novels, poetry, film, etc. Works may be
analyzed in terms of style, influence, cultural significance, political
importance, and/or commercial success.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Conservation Biology
description:
Introduction to conservation biology including both biological and social
issues related to the loss of species and habitats. Intended for students with
no background in biological sciences.

name: Gateway to Data Science
description:
Probability concepts: Events and sample spaces; random variables; mass,
density and distribution functions; parametric families; parameter estimation
and confidence intervals; hypothesis testing; Central Limit Theorem.
Recommended as alternative to course 13 for students with a background in
calculus and programming.
prereq:
MAT 016B or MAT 021B or MAT 017B; Ability to program in a high-level computer
language.

name: Ethnic Conflict
description:
Compares the claims of the state and ethnic peoples in countries undergoing
internal conflicts; e.g., South Africa, Northern Ireland. Analyzes the role of
the international community in facilitating the peaceful resolution of
conflicts.

name: Res In Practical Pol
description:
Supervised preparation of an extensive paper relating internship experience to
concepts, literature, and theory of political science.
prereq:
POL 192A; POL 192B; open only to Political Science-Public Service majors, for
whom it is required.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication. May be taught abroad
in a Spanish speaking country under the supervision of a UC Davis
faculty/lecturer.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Work & Employment
description:
Historical and contemporary overview of employment, work, and occupations in
American society. Study of authority and power relations, labor markets,
control systems, stratification, and corporate structures, and how these
factors shape work in diverse or organizational and employment setting.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing or
enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Regression Analysis
description:
Simple linear regression, variable selection techniques, stepwise regression,
analysis of covariance, influence measures, computing packages.

name: Senior Seminar
description:
Capstone course for senior Womens Studies majors, which focuses on current
issues on feminism as they impact theory, public policy, and practice.

name: Sampling Theory
College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Popular Culture
description:
Social mechanisms that shape modern popular culture. High, folk, and mass
culture: historical emergence of popular culture. Mass media,
commercialization, ideology and cultural styles. Theories and methods for
analyzing cultural expressions in pop music, street art, film, television, and
advertising.

name: Practice in Data Science
description:
Principles and practice of interdisciplinary, collaborative data analysis;
complete case study review and team data analysis project.
prereq: STA 106; STA 108; (STA 130B or STA 131B); (STA 141 or STA 141A)

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Social & Personal Devel
description:
Social and personality development of children, infancy through adolescence.
Topics include the development of personality, achievement motivation, self-
understanding, sex-role identity, and antisocial behavior. Emphasis on the
interface between biological and social factors.

name: Seminar
description: Intensive treatment of a special topic or problem of psychological interest.
prereq: Junior or senior standing; major in Psychology or consent of instructor.

name: American Pol Thought
description:
Origins and nature of American political thought. Principles of American
thought as they emerge from the founding period to the present.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Perception
description:
Cognitive organizations related to measurable physical energy changes mediated
through sensory channels. Perception of objects, space, motion, events.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience off and on campus in all subject areas offered in the
department. Internships supervised by a member of the faculty.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Completion of 84 units.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Punishment & Corrections
description:
Origins, characteristics, and consequences of various sanctions and punishment
regimes including fines, banishment, incarceration, deportation, and
execution.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Sociology of Childhood
description:
Contemporary childhood in historical, cross-cultural, and global perspectives.
Examine changes in understanding of the nature of childhood and "best
interests of the child" by class, race, gender, geographic region, and
historical period.

name: Self & Society
description:
Exploration of how self and identity are formed and transformed by
socialization and social interaction in relation to roles, groups,
institutions, power, and social change. Consideration of how people make
decisions, fall in love, and come to blows.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Internship
description:
Work experience related to Fermentation Science (Enology) or Plant Science
(Viticulture) majors. Internships must be approved and supervised by a member
of the department or major faculty, but are arranged by the student.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Completion of 84 units.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Tutor Plant Sciences
description:
Leading small voluntary discussion or lab groups affiliated with one of the
department's regular courses.
prereq:
Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing, completion of course being
tutored or the equivalent.

name: Religion & Language
description:
Basic toolkit for studying religious discourse in a variety of traditions.
Concentration on the sacred and profane, the wondrous and ordinary, and the
mystical and reasonable.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Development of Memory
description: Theory and research on memory development with focus on infancy and childhood.
prereq:
PSC 001; PSC 041; and any Psychology upper division course from Core Group A
or D.

name: Psychology & Law
description:
Current theoretical and empirical issues in the study of psychology and law.
Topics include eyewitness testimony, child abuse, jury decision making,
juvenile delinquency and criminology, prediction of violence, insanity
defense, and memory for traumatic events.

name: Writ in HumDev and Psych
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in Human Development and Psychology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: The Spanish Black Legend
description:
Examination of anti-Hispanic prejudice in the United States focusing on the
"Black Legend," a 16th-century, anti-Spanish myth underpinning the doctrine of
"Manifest Destiny." Exploration of the Legend's presence in contemporary
American society through interviews and analysis of school textbooks.

name: Statistical Data Science
description:
Introduction to computing for data analysis and visualization, and simulation,
using a high-level language (e.g., R). Computational reasoning,
computationally intensive statistical methods, reading tabular and non-
standard data.
prereq: STA 010 or STA 013 or STA 032 or STA 100

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Special Study
description:
Special study of a topic or an author to be determined in consultation with an
individual faculty member. May be taught abroad.

name: Textile Color Lab
description:
Demonstrates various aspects of dyeing, printing, and finishing of textile
substrates including the effect of fiber and finish type, and physical and
chemical variables on dyeing and finishing processes and on the properties of
the resultant textile.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Social Relationships
description:
Social and cultural factors influencing friendships and intimate
relationships. Topics include relationship development, relationship
maintenance, and relationship loss.

name: Intro Gender Studies
description:
Introduction to interdisciplinary, critical gender studies. Addresses the
emergence of women’s, gender and feminist studies internationally, its links
to women’s movements, and its influence within the various arts, humanities
and social science disciplines.

name: Spanish Art
description:
Spanish art and the different historical, sociological and political
manifestations that frame it. History of art, including Paleolithic, Roman,
Visigothic, Romanesque, Goth, Renaissance, Baroque, Neoclassic and
Contemporary art. May be taught abroad.

name: The Criminal Justice Sys
description:
Sociological analysis of the different components of the criminal justice
system including the emergence and interpretation of criminal laws, the
contemporary roles and functions of the police, criminal courts and
correctional institutions.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Intro Social Rsch
description:
Examination of the methodological problems of social research. Selection and
definition of problems of investigation, data-gathering techniques, and
sampling.

name: Technology and the Body
description:
The history and analysis of the relationships between human bodies and
technologies in modern society. Dominant and eccentric examples of how human
bodies and technologies influence one another and reveal underlying cultural
assumptions.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Continuation of courses 1 and 1S in the areas of grammar and basic language
skills.
prereq: SPA 001 or SPA 001S; Or the equivalent.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Elementary Russian
description: Continuation of grammar and language skills developed in RUS 002.

name: Adv Stats for Bio Sci
description:
Basic experimental designs, two-factor ANOVA without interactions, repeated
measures ANOVA, ANCOVA, random effects vs. fixed effects, multiple regression,
basic model building, resampling methods, multiple comparisons, multivariate
methods, generalized linear models, Monte Carlo simulations.

name: World Viticulture
description:
Study of the diversity of viticulture, both geographical and historical.
History of grape growing and its spread throughout the world will be covered,
along with discussions of current viticultural practices in different parts of
the world, including California.

name: Intro Comp Politics
description:
Introduction to basic concepts in political analysis and application of them
in comparative studies of selected countries. Coverage is given to cultural
and other informal dimensions of politics as well as to more formal political
and governmental structures.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Spanish Composition I
description:
Development of writing skills by way of reading, discussion, and analysis of
authentic materials, literary texts, and videos. Selective review of grammar.
Composition, journals, individual and group projects.
prereq: SPA 022 or SPA 022S or SPA 022V or SPA 022Y

name: Intro to Math Statistics
description:
Testing theory, tools and applications from probability theory, Linear model
theory, ANOVA, goodness-of-fit.

name: Legal Writing
description:
Advanced principles of critical thinking, argumentation, and style, with
special emphasis on their application in the legal profession. Suitable for
students planning careers in law, business, administration, or management.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Princ Fashion Mktg
description:
Study of basic elements of fashion marketing including philosophy and
objectives, organization, merchandising, pricing, promotion and personnel.

name: Cognitive Neuroscience
description:
Neuroscientific foundations of higher mental processes including attention,
memory, language, higher-level perceptual and motor processes, and
consciousness. Emphasis on the neural mechanisms which form the substrates of
human cognition and the relationship of mind to brain.
prereq:
PSC 001; PSC 041; or Consent of Instructor. PSC 101, PSC 121, or PSC 129
recommended.

name: General Psychology
description:
Principles and basic concepts of psychology. The empirical study of individual
behavior including perception, cognition, development, personality, social
interactions and the biological underpinnings of behavior.

name: Pol Global Ineq
description:
Analysis of current economic and political international relations resulting
from a long standing division of the global system into rich and poor regions.

name: Scientific Study Politic
description:
Introduction to the basic principles of the scientific study of politics.
Research design and empirical analysis of data with applications to different
methodological approaches and different substantive areas in political
science.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Env Chng Dis & Pub Hlth
description:
Analysis of environmental changes from pre-history to the present and their
influence on disease distribution, virulence and public health. Focus on
critical study of many human-driven environmental changes and the accelerated
transformation/spread of pathogens under globalization.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: General Psychology
description:
Introduction to empirical approaches. Focus on perception, cognition,
personality and social psychology, and biological aspects of behavior.

name: Intro to Public Health
description:
Provide basic concepts and controversies in public health, basic science of
public health, social and behavioral factors in health and disease,
environmental and occupational health issues, the relationship of public
health to the medical care system and health care reform.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Topics Gender Studies
description:
In-depth examination of a women's studies topic related to the research
interests of the instructor.

name: General Psychology
description:
Principles and basic concepts of psychology. The empirical study of individual
behavior including perception, cognition, development, personality, social
interactions and the biological underpinnings of behavior.

name: Democracy
description: Examination of conditions promoting democratization and democratic stability.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing

relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: National Security Policy
description:
Development of national security policies since 1945. Analysis of deterrence
and assumptions upon which it is based. Effects of nuclear weapons upon
conduct of war, alliance systems, and the international system. Prospects of
security and stability through arms control.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Applied Linguistics
description:
Exploration of the major theoretical and practical issues concerning learning
Spanish as a second language. For students interested in teaching Spanish as a
career. May be taught abroad.
prereq: SPA 024 or SPA 033; or Consent of Instructor. LIN 001 recommended.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Applied Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; probability; random variables; expectation; binomial,
normal, Poisson, other univariate distributions; joint distributions; sampling
distributions, central limit theorem; properties of estimators; linear
combinations of random variables; testing and estimation; Minitab computing
package.
prereq: (STA 013 or STA 032 or STA 100); (MAT 016B or MAT 017B or MAT 021B)

name: Deviance
description:
Social structural sources, institutional practices and microprocesses
associated with illegality, evil, disease, immorality, disability, racial and
class differences, citizenship, and the body. Special emphasis on expert
knowledge and the production and management of social difference.

name: Directed Grp Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing Social Justice
description:
Advanced instruction in writing for Social Justice, using an interdisciplinary
approach combining feminist, critical race, ethnic, cultural, and
transnational studies; practice in techniques of research and styles of
communication for diverse audiences. Suitable for activists in community
organizing, non-profits, politics.
prereq: UWP 001; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Internship Pub Aff
description:
Supervised internship and study in political, governmental, or related
organizations.
prereq:
POL 192A; enrollment dependent on availability of intern positions with
highest priority assigned to students with Political Science-Public Service
major; upper division standing.

name: Political Sociology
description:
Relation of social cleavages and social cohesion to the functioning of
political institutions; the social bases of local and national power
structures; social sources of political movement, analysis of concepts of
alienation, revolution, ideology, ruling class, and elite.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses

for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

organizations.

Enrollment dependent on availability of intern positions with highest priority
assigned to students with Political Science Public Service major; upper
division standing.

name: Theories Int'l Politics
description:
Major contemporary approaches to the study of international politics,
including balance of power, game theory, Marxist-Leninist theory, systems
theory, and decision-making analysis.

name: Russian Politics/Policy
description:
Democratization, state-building and economic reform; creation of new
institutions; impacts of Soviet rule.

name: Hormones & Behavior
description:
Endocrine physiology with an emphasis on the principles of behavior.
Fundamental relationships between hormones and various behaviors engaged in by
the organism during its lifetime. Role of hormones in behavioral homeostasis,
social behavior, reproductive behavior, parental behavior, adaptation to
stress.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as

prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
The student, through fieldwork in a community health agency, learns to apply
theory and concepts learned in the classroom.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division and graduate students.

name: Complex Organizations
description:
Develops a sociological approach to organizations theory. Designed to
introduce sociological concepts, address the alternative psychological and
economic models, and involve students in the practice of organizational
analysis.

name: Community Networks
description:
Impact and implications of computer-based networks in community, civic, and
social life. Subjects may include community-access computer sites,
neighborhood wireless networks, the digital divide, open-source software, and
citizen action.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Span-Native Speakers III
description:
Development of writing skills, with emphasis on experimenting with various
writing styles: analytical, argumentative, and creative. Analytical review of
literary genres. Written essays will be assigned. Students will develop a
research paper. Designed for students whose native language is Spanish.

name: Textile Coloration
Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.

name: Writing in Sociology
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in Sociology and related academic and professional fields.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Topic Span Linguistics
description:
Study of specialized topics in Spanish linguistics, for example: language and
use; text and context; language and society; bilingualism; Spanish
dialectology; syntax and semantics.

name: Social & Personal Devel
description:
Social and personality development of children, infancy through adolescence.
Topics include the development of personality, achievement motivation, self-
understanding, sex-role identity, and antisocial behavior. Emphasis on the
interface between biological and social factors.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Developmental Psychobiol
description:
The biology of behavioral development; survey and integration of the
organismic and environmental processes that regulate the development of
behavior.

name: Self & Society
description:
Exploration of how self and identity are formed and transformed by
socialization and social interaction in relation to roles, groups,
institutions, power, and social change. Consideration of how people make
decisions, fall in love, and come to blows.

name: Princ of Pharm Tox Intro
description:
Hybrid course provides training in core concepts of pharmacological and
toxicological sciences. Develop higher-order problem solving and critical
thinking skills.
prereq:
Upper division standing in a science major; chemistry through organic
chemistry and general biology, or consent from instructor; good standing with
university; computing capability using MS Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint®, menu
driven software programs, SmartSite; computer, or ready access to a computer,
with broadband Internet access.

name: Writing in Education
description:
Advanced expository writing in the contemporary American classroom. Strongly
recommended for teaching credential candidates.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Comm Tutoring in Writing
description:
Field experience, with individuals or in K-12 classroom instruction, focusing
on reading- and writing-to-learn strategies in any subject area.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
The student, through fieldwork in a community health agency, learns to apply
theory and concepts learned in the classroom.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division and graduate students.

name: Intro Technocult Studies
description:
Contemporary developments in the fine and performing arts, media arts, digital
arts, and literature as they relate to technological and scientific practices.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Criminology
description:
Sociological analysis of criminal behavior in relation to social structure and
the criminalization process.

name: Survey of Religion
description:
Basic concepts introduced through readings of the primary religious
literature. Discussion of central ideas (creation, history, law, prophecy,
suffering, mysticism, asceticism, karma, reincarnation, moksha, etc.);
readings from the Bible, Bhagavad Gita, the Koran, selections from Plato and
early Buddhist writings.

name: Language & Cognition
description:
Introduction to the cognitive processes involved in language comprehension and
production. Topics include the biological foundations of language, speech
perception, word recognition, syntax, reading ability, and pragmatics.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (PSC 100 or PSC 135); or Consent of Instructor.

name: Stat Analys Psych Data
description:
Probability theory, sampling distributions, statistical inference, and
hypothesis testing using standard parametric and correlational approaches.
Simple regression analysis, multiple regression analysis, non-parametric
statistics, introduction to multivariate statistics, with applications in
psychology.

name: Physiological Psychology
description:
Relationship of brain structure and function to behavior, motivation, emotion,
language, and learning in humans and other animals. An introduction to the
methodology of physiological psychology and neuroscience.

name: Abnormal Psych
description:
Descriptive and functional account of behavioral disorders, with primary
consideration given to neurotic and psychotic behavior.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Sociology of Culture
description:
Sociological approaches to study of historical and contemporary culture and
mass media, and their structuring in relation to social actors, institutions,
stratification, power, the production of culture, audiences, and the
significance of culture in processes of change.

name: Writ in Intl Relations
description: Advanced instruction in writing in international relations.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing in the Fine Arts
description:
Advanced instruction in writing about the arts and practice in effective
styles of communication.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Regression Analysis
description:
Simple linear regression, variable selection techniques, stepwise regression,
analysis of covariance, influence measures, computing packages.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writ in HumDev and Psych
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in Human Development and Psychology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Plants & Society
description:
Dependence of human societies on plant and plant products. Plants as resources
for food, fiber, health, enjoyment and environmental services. Sustainable
uses of plants for food production, raw materials, bioenergy, and
environmental conservation. Global population growth and future food supplies.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Advanced Russian
description:
Continuation of RUS 101B. Topics in Russian grammar for the advanced student.
Reading and discussion of journalistic texts and classic and contemporary
literature. Conversational exercises utilizing literary and colloquial
variants of current Russian speech.

name: The Ramayana
description:
Exploration of the Indian epic, Ramayana, through the lens of literature,
performance, and visual art. Emphasis on the text's diversity and its
contemporary global relevance. Topics include Ramayanas in Southeast Asia, and
in various South Asian diaspora communities.

name: International Law
description:
Selected topics in international law; territory, sovereign immunity,
responsibility, the peaceful settlement or nonsettlement of international
disputes.

name: Sci & Soc Seminar
description:
In-depth examination at an upper division level of a special topic in Science
and Society. Emphasis upon student participation in learning.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Developmental Psychology
description:
An ontogenetic account of human behavior through adolescence with emphasis on
motor skills, mental abilities, motivation, and social interaction.

name: Spec Study Am Pol
description:
Intensive examination of one or more special problems appropriate to American
politics.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Intro to Bio Psych
description:
Survey and integration of the relationships between behavior and biological
processes, including physiology, genes, development, ecology, and evolution.

name: Field Methods in WFCB
description:
Introduction to field methods for monitoring and studying wild vertebrates and
their habitats, with an emphasis on ecology and conservation. Required weekend
field trips.
prereq:
EVE 101 { can be concurrent } or ESP 100 { can be concurrent }; (BIS 002A, BIS
002B, BIS 002C); or equivalent course of EVE 101 or ESP 100 (can be taken
concurrently), and consent of instructor.

name: Exp Digital Cinema II
description:
Continuation of course 100 with further exploration of digital cinema
creation. Additional topics include new modes of distribution, streaming,
installation and exhibition.

name: Legislative Process
description:
Legislative process with emphasis on the United States Congress; legislative
organization and procedures, legislative leadership and policy making,
legislators and constituents, relations between Congress and other agencies.

name: Principles Lit Criticism
description:
Principles of literary criticism applied to the study of fiction, drama,
poetry, and essay of major literary writers of the Hispanic world.

name: Intermediate Spanish
description:
Review and development of grammar, vocabulary and composition acquired in the
first year through exercises and reading of modern texts.
prereq: SPA 003 or SPA 003S or SPA 003V or SPA 003Y

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Plant Propagation
description:
Principles and practices of propagating plants covering anatomical,
physiological, and practical aspects.

name: Mol Cell Postharvest Bio
description:
Basic concepts and current knowledge of issues relevant to postharvest
biology. Mechanisms of fruit ripening, senescence, programmed cell death.
Metabolism and functions of phytohormones, carbohydrates, lipids, pigments,
flavor compounds, and phytonutrients at molecular and cellular levels.
prereq: PLS 002 or BIS 001C or BIS 002C; Or equivalent.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Intro to Epidemiology
description:
Practice of epidemiology as it relates to human populations. Content is
fundamental to the Public Health minor and a required core course.

name: History Spanish Language
description:
Spanish language from its roots in spoken Latin to modernity. Emphasis on the
close relationship between historical events and language change, and the role
that literature plays in language standardization.
prereq: SPA 024 or SPA 033; or Consent of Instructor. LIN 001 recommended.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Contemporary Leadership
description:
Leadership, including issues, skills, and practices as they relate to
individuals, organizations, diverse social settings and communities. Written
and verbal communications, personality styles for collaborative work, and
ethics.

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Organic Crop Prod Pract
description:
Principles and practices of organic production of annual crops. Including
organic crops, soil, and pest management, cover cropping, composting, seeding,
transplanting, irrigation, harvesting and marketing.

name: Human Memory
description:
Consideration of major theories of human learning and memory with critical
examination of relevant experimental data.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (STA 013 or STA 100); or Consent of Instructor.

name: Writing in Bio Sci
description: Advanced instruction in writing in biology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Internship in Writing
description: Internships in fields where students can practice their skills.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; and Consent of Instructor. Or the equivalent.

name: Pop Dyn and Est
description:
Description of bird, mammal and fish population dynamics, modeling philosophy,
techniques for estimation of animal abundance (e.g., mark-recapture, change-
inratio, etc.), mathematical models of populations (e.g., Leslie matrix,
logistic, dynamic pool, stockrecruitment); case histories.
prereq:
(MAT 016A, MAT 016B); STA 013; (BIS 002A, BIS 002B, BIS 002C); Or the
equivalent of STA 013; an upper division course in ecology.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Spanish Language Cinema
description:
Analysis of the culture of the Spanish-speaking world through film in
translation. Emphasis on the cultural information illustrated by the films; no
prior knowledge of cinematography required. Films with subtitles. May be
taught abroad in a Spanish speaking country, in Spanish, under the supervision
of UC Davis faculty.

name: Soils-Land Use
description:
Soils are considered as elements in land use planning and environmental
quality. Topics include: soil survey reports, remote sensing, land capability
classification, soil erosion/conservation, waste disposal on soils and soil
reclamation. One one-day field trip.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Principles Lit Criticism
description:
Principles of literary criticism applied to the study of fiction, drama,
poetry, and essay of major literary writers of the Hispanic world.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Cognitive Development
description:
Theories, methods, evidence, and debates in the field of cognitive
development, such as nature/nurture, constraints on learning, and the role of
plasticity. Topics include attention, memory, concepts about the physical and
social world, and language.

name: Writing in Engineering
description: Advanced instruction in writing in engineering.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Darwin
description:
Students will explore the life and times of Charles Darwin and will trace the
development of evolutionary thinking before and after the Origin of Species to
appreciate its place in Victorian society and in the corpus of Darwins
thought.
prereq: Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Writing/Visual Rhetoric
description:
Introduction to writing needs, conventions, and genres in design contexts.
Emphasis on applying critical reading, analysis, and writing skills to
designed products, such as graphics, visual communications, and clothes, and
designed spaces, such as exhibitions and interior architecture.

name: Bas Cnpt/Pol Thry
description:
Analysis of such concepts as the individual, community, liberty, equality,
justice, and natural law as developed in the works of the major political
philosophers.

name: South Asian Religions
description:
Introduction to South Asian religions, including Hinduism, Buddhism, Islam,
Jainism and Sikhism. Traces historical developments from Vedic texts and their
ascetic reformulation by sages such as Yajnavalkya, Siddhartha Gautama, and
Mahavira into our global present.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Critical Food Studies
description:
Construction of gender through production and consumption of goods and
services. Transnational movement of peoples and products. Topics may include
fashion, film, food, and technology.

name: Developmental Disorders
description:
Current scientific knowledge of the influences of biological, cognitive, and
environmental factors on the emergence of disorders with onset in childhood.
Examples include autism spectrum, ADD/ADHD, dyslexia and dyscalculia. Emphasis
placed on understanding these disorders, their causes and their treatments.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; (PSC 140 or PSC 141 or HDE 100A or HDE 100B)

name: British Politics
description: Evolution, politics, and contemporary problems of Britain's political system.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Willow Clinic
description:
Student run clinic for upper division students interested in learning about
and meeting the unique health care needs for the homeless population.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. UC Davis enrollment; upper division standing.

name: Scientific Study Politic
description:
Introduction to the basic principles of the scientific study of politics.
Research design and empirical analysis of data with applications to different
methodological approaches and different substantive areas in political
science.

name: CA State Govt & Politics
description:
California political system. Political culture, constitution, elections and
parties, direct democracy, legislature, governor, executive branch, courts,
finances, state-local relations and policy issues.

name: Internship
description:
Upper-division internship for students enrolled in the Sustainable Agriculture
and Food Systems program of study.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division standing.

name: Intro Sociology
description:
Principles and basic concepts of sociology. The study of groups, culture,
collective behavior, classes and caste, community and ecology, role, status,
and personality.

name: Eval Rsch Methods
description:
Surveys applications of research methods to the evaluation of social programs,
primarily emphasizing methodological issues, e.g., research design and data
collection; uses of evaluation research are also discussed and placed in
theoretical context. Participation in an evaluation project.
prereq: SOC 001 or SOC 002 or SOC 003 recommended; SOC 046A and SOC 046B recommended.

name: College Writing-SCC157E
description: Not available.

name: Modern Islam Auth/Tradit
description:
Survey of Islamic thought, social organization, politics from 18th century
through present. Focus on changing notations of moral authority and tradition.
Concentration on Middle East and South Asia with sustained treatment of North
American engagements with the Islamic world.

name: Adv Stat Computing
description:
High-performance computing in high-level data analysis languages; different
computational approaches and paradigms for efficient analysis of big data;
interfaces to compiled languages; R and Python programming languages; high-
level parallel computing; MapReduce; parallel algorithms and reasoning.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Int Social Research
description:
Data-analysis techniques, measurement, scaling, multivariate analysis, and
quantitative measures of association.

name: Winemaking Seminar
description:
Outside speakers on a specific winemaking topic chosen for the quarter.
Discussion with the speaker hosted by the faculty member(s) in charge.

name: Wine Sensory Evaluation
description:
Sensory evaluation of wines and model systems using discrimination tests,
ranking, descriptive analysis and time-intensity analysis. Data will be
analyzed by appropriate statistical tests and the results interpreted in
extensive weekly lab reports.

name: Ethnic Women Writers
description:
Literature, especially novels, written by contemporary women of color in the
United States, understood in their socio-economic, cultural and historical
contexts.

name: Lab Biol Cons Mammals
description:
Laboratory exercises in the morphology, systematics, species identification,
anatomy, and adaptations of wild mammals to different habitats.
prereq: WFC 110 { can be concurrent }; and Consent of Instructor.

name: Legal Writing
description:
Advanced principles of critical thinking, argumentation, and style, with
special emphasis on their application in the legal profession. Suitable for
students planning careers in law, business, administration, or management.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Ster, Prej, & Stigma
description:
Social psychological underpinnings of stereotyping, prejudice, and stigma from
sociocultural, motivational, and cognitive perspectives. Topics include:
origins, maintenance, change, effects on person perception and memory, and the
automaticity/controllability of stereotyping and prejudice.

name: Analysis of Variance
description:
Basics of experimental design. One-way and two-way fixed effects analysis of
variance models. Randomized complete and incomplete block design. Multiple
comparisons procedures. One-way random effects model.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Intrmed Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing short multi-paragraph texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Topics in STS
description:
In depth treatment of selected topis in the history and philosophy of science.
Possible topics include history of modern physics, history of molecular
biology, science and society, science and power, scientific explanation,
technology and culture, theory testing.
prereq:
Course in History and Philosophy of Science or other course-work relevant to
topic.

name: Writing in Science
description:
Writing abstracts, research proposals, scientific papers, other forms of
scientific communication. Presenting data graphically. Primarily for students
engaged in or planning careers in basic or applied research.
prereq:
UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing or
enrollment in a graduate science curriculum.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Not available.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; and Consent of Instructor. Or the equivalent.

name: Nonparametric Statistics
description:
Sign and Wilcoxon tests, Walsh averages. Two-sample procedures. Inferences
concerning scale. Kruskal-Wallis test. Measures of association. Chi square and
Kolmogorov-Smirnov tests.

name: Queer Studies
description:
Study of queer sexualities, identities, theories, practices. Alternative
sexualities as historical, social, and cultural constructions in intersections
with race, gender, class, nationality. Interdisciplinary exploration of sexual
liberation and the regulation of sexuality through history, theory and
expressive cultural forms.
prereq: WMS 070 recommended or consent of instructor.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Intro to Spanish Culture
description:
Introduction to history, geography and culture of Spain. Art, history of
ideas, and everyday cultural manifestations. Introduction to critical reading
and textual analysis. May be taught abroad in a Spanish speaking country under
the supervision of UC Davis faculty.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Science Journalism
description: Instruction in the elements and practices of science journalism.
prereq: Satisfaction of the upper division writing requirement.

name: Social Movements
description:
Analysis of several aspects of social movements: mobilization, forms of
organization, ideology, recruitment, leadership, strategies and tactics,
development, effects. Frequent use of sound and film materials.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Completion of grammar sequence and continuing practice of all language skills
using cultural texts.
prereq: SPA 002 or SPA 002S or SPA 002V or SPA 002Y

name: Writing in Bio Sci
description: Advanced instruction in writing in biology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Directed Group Study
description: Directed group study.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Intermediate Spanish II
description:
Continuation of SPA 021, SPA 021V, SPA 021Y, SPA 022S, or previous high school
experience in the areas of grammar and intermediate language skills. Online
format combining synchronous chatting with technologically based materials.
prereq:
SPA 021 or SPA 021S or SPA 021V or SPA 021Y; Or equivalent from previous high
school language experience.

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within
and beyond the University. Different writing modes, including narrative,
analysis, explanation, argument, critique.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Internship Community Hth
description:
The student, through fieldwork in a community health agency, learns to apply
theory and concepts learned in the classroom.
prereq: Consent of Instructor. Upper division and graduate students.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Journalism
description:
Non-fiction for magazines and newspapers, with attention to style and
language. Emphasis on research, interviewing, market analysis, and query
letters.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Elementary Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; basic probability concepts; binomial, normal,
Student's t, and chi-square distributions. Hypothesis testing and confidence
intervals for one and two means and proportions. Regression.
prereq: Two years of high school algebra or Mathematics D.

name: Social Psychology
description:
Behavior of the individual in the group. Examination of basic psychological
processes in social situations, surveying various problems of social
interaction: group tensions, norm-development, attitudes, values, public
opinion, status.

name: Directed Gp Study
description: Directed group study. May be taught abroad.

name: Amer Natl Govt
description:
Survey of American national government, including the constitutional system,
political culture, parties, elections, the presidency, Congress, and the
courts.

name: History of Psychology
description:
Development of psychological thought and research in context of history of
philosophy and science.
prereq: PSC 001; PSC 041; Upper division standing or consent of instructor.

name: Writing in History
description: Advanced instruction in writing in history.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Flower Power
description:
Introduction to the art and science of using and growing flowers to harness
the power that is represented by their aesthetic beauty. Handling, production,
arranging, breeding and marketing of flowers. Emphasis on potted plants and
cut-flowers.

name: Intro/Wine Making
description:
Overview of the history of wine, viticulture, fermentation, winery operations,
the physiology of wine consumption, wines produced in California and other
major wine-producing regions and the sensory evaluation of wine. May be taught
abroad.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Introduction to Spanish grammar and development of all language skills in a
cultural context with special emphasis on communication.

name: Biol Cons Wild Mammals
description:
Origins, evolution, diversification, and geographical and ecological
distributions of mammals. Morphological, physiological, reproductive, and
behavioral adaptations of mammals to their environment.
prereq:
(BIS 002A, BIS 002B, BIS 002C); (EVE 101 { can be concurrent } or ESP 100 {
can be concurrent }); Or equivalent course to ESP 100 or EVE 101.

name: Internship in Writing
description: Internships in fields where students can practice their skills.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; and Consent of Instructor. Or the equivalent.

optometry.

prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Sustainable Nutri Mangmt
description:
Availability of nutrients in organic and conventional agricultural, vineyard,
orchard and plantation forest soils; management of fertilizers, cover crops,
compost, sewage sludge and manures for crop production and to prevent loss to
the environment is emphasized.

Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.

name: Applied Statistics
description:
Descriptive statistics; probability; random variables; expectation; binomial,
normal, Poisson, other univariate distributions; joint distributions; sampling
distributions, central limit theorem; properties of estimators; linear
combinations of random variables; testing and estimation; Minitab computing
package.
prereq: (STA 013 or STA 032 or STA 100); (MAT 016B or MAT 017B or MAT 021B)

name: Advanced Composition
description:
Instruction in advanced principles of expository writing. Writing tasks within

analysis, explanation, argument, critique.

name: Writing in the Fine Arts
description:
Advanced instruction in writing about the arts and practice in effective
styles of communication.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Multivar Data Analysis
description:
Multivariate normal distribution; Mahalanobis distance; sampling distributions
of the mean vector and covariance matrix; Hotellings T2; simultaneous
inference; one-way MANOVA; discriminant analysis; principal components;
canonical correlation; factor analysis. Intensive use of computer analyses and
real data sets.

name: Wine Tech/Winery Systems
description:
Process technologies and process systems that are used in modern commercial
wineries. Lectures, demonstrations, problem solving sessions, and possible
field trips. Includes grape preparation and fermentation equipment; post-
fermentation processing equipment; winery utilities, cleaning systems, and
waste treatment.

name: Special Study
description: Special study for advanced undergraduates.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.

Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.

name: Elementary Spanish
description:
Continuation of Spanish 001 and 001S in the areas of grammar and basic
language skills. Offered in a Spanish speaking country under the supervision
of UC Davis faculty/lecturer.

name: College Writing-SCC157P
description: Not available.

name: Spanish for Professions
description:
For students with an advanced level of Spanish interested in the use of
Spanish in the health care, legal and law enforcement and marketing and
business professions. Field trips documenting the use of Spanish in the public
context.

name: Applied Stat for Bio Sci
description:
Descriptive statistics, probability, sampling distributions, estimation,
hypothesis testing, contingency tables, ANOVA, regression; implementation of
statistical methods using computer package.

name: Spanish Lit To 1700
description:
Survey of Spanish literature (narrative, poetry and drama) to 1700, Emphasis
on the multicultural birth of the Spanish culture, the formation and growth of
the Spanish language and letters through its written records and the
literature of the early period.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Intermediate Spanish
description:
Development of all language skills through exercises and reading of modern
texts. Development on more difficult grammar concepts and further practice on
composition.
prereq: SPA 021 or SPA 021S or SPA 021V or SPA 021Y

name: Strategy of Politics
description:
Introduction to game theory. Explanation of the behavior of individuals in
strategic interaction. Rational and behavioral approaches. Applications to
political science and other fields.

name: Scientific Study Politic
description:
Introduction to the basic principles of the scientific study of politics.
Research design and empirical analysis of data with applications to different
methodological approaches and different substantive areas in political
science.

name: Exp Digital Cinema I
description:
Experimental approaches to the making of film and video in the age of digital
technologies. Builds upon foundation provided by course 20. Instruction in
technical, conceptual, creative, and critical skills for taking a project from
idea to fruition.
prereq:
CTS 020 or ART 012 or TCS 007B; TCS 170B; or equivalent with consent of
instructor.

name: Intro to Prof Editing
description:
Introduction to general editing practices and principles, with an emphasis on
professional editing in organizational contexts, including academia and the
workplace. Extensive practice in copy, comprehensive, and collaborative
editing.
prereq: satisfaction of the upper division writing requirement.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Writing in Bio Sci
description: Advanced instruction in writing in biology.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Race Relations
description:
Functions of the social definitions of race and racial groups. Analysis of
racial conflict, oppression, and other forms of ethnic stratification. Models
of ethnic interaction and social change. Emphasis on racial relationships
within the U.S.

name: Social Problems
description:
General sociological consideration of contemporary social problems in relation
to sociocultural change and programs for improvement.

name: Latin Amer Short Story
description:
Evolution of the Latin American short story from the 19th century to the
present. Emphasis on the contemporary period.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: The Family
description:
Contemporary family life in historical and cross-cultural perspective. How
different family forms arose, their significance today and prospects for
further family change. Attention to power relations within and beyond the
family and to the social implications of family transformation.

name: Intermed Soc Stat
description:
Intermediate level course in statistical analysis of social data, emphasizing
the logic and use of statistical measures, procedures, and mathematical models
especially relevant to sociological analysis.

name: Sociology of Law
description:
Law considered as social control; relation of legal institutions to society as
affecting judicial decision making and administration of justice. Lawyers as
an occupational group. Legal reform.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:
Reading and writing source/research-based texts for academic purposes.
Suitable for students whose primary home language was not English.

name: Writing in Education
description:
Advanced expository writing in the contemporary American classroom. Strongly
recommended for teaching credential candidates.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Writing Research Papers
description:
Critical reading, analysis, documentation, and writing research-based
assignments. Formulation of research topics and development of effective
arguments. Reading and writing assignments may focus on a single theme.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent.

name: Gender &Post Colonialism
description:
Explores changing configurations of race, gender, sexuality, class and
implications for governmentality in one or more colonial or postcolonial
regimes in one or more societies.

name: Writing in Health Prof
description:
Advanced expository writing common in the health professions, emphasizing
effective communication between the writer and different audiences. Topics
relate to health, disability, and disease. Suitable for students planning
careers in professions such as medicine, dentistry, physical therapy,
optometry.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Latin Amer Lit 1900 Pres
description:
Latin American literature from 1900 to the present. Reading selections include
fiction, poetry, drama, essays, testimonio, etc.
prereq: SPA 100 or SPA 100S or SPA 141 or SPA 141S or SPA 170 or SPA 170S

name: Obj Orient Prog Artists
description:
Introduction to object-oriented programming for artists. Focus on
understanding the metaphors and potential of object-oriented programming for
sound, video, performance, and interactive installations.

name: College Writing-SCC157S
description: Not available.

name: Cognitive Development
description:
Theories, methods, evidence, and debates in the field of cognitive
development, such as nature/nurture, constraints on learning, and the role of
plasticity. Topics include attention, memory, concepts about the physical and
social world, and language.

name: Bio of Animal Viruses
description:
Fundamental physical and chemical properties of animal viruses; methods of
propagation, purification and assay. Mechanisms of viral replication and
pathogenesis of viral infections in man and animals. Immunity to virus
diseases and oncogenic properties of animal viruses.

name: Soil Genesis
description:
Recognition and description of soils; chemical, biological and physical
processes of soil formation. Factors of soil formation. Interactions of soils
with diverse ecosystems. Introduction to soil classification. Practice using
soil taxonomy. Practical experience describing soil properties in the field.

name: Russian Culture
description:
Trends in Russian culture and the relationship between artists and the
government. Topics: recent changes in the cultural scene, postmodernist trends
in literature, visual art, film, and theater.

name: Pol of Interdependence
description:
In the past several decades, growing economic interdependence has generated
new problems in international relations. Deals with difficulties in managing
complex interdependence and its implication on national policies and politics.

name: Res Meth Techocult Stud
description:
Introduction to basic research methods for Technocultural Studies: electronic
and archived images, sounds and data, satellite downlinking, radiowave
scanning, and oral histories.

name: Academic Literacies
description:
Composition, the essay, paragraph structure, diction, and related topics.
Frequent writing assignments.

name: Jewish Identities & Comm
description:
Sociology of Jewish life, analyzing challenges to Jewish identity and
community in the diaspora. Diversity within the Jewish community,
Americanization, women, new immigrants, post-Holocaust Jewish identity, and
LGBT Jews.

name: Business Writing
description:
Effective communication in and for organizations, including businesses
(corporations), government agencies, and non-profit organizations. Suitable
for students entering careers that require substantial communications, such as
management, public relations, and grant writing.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Environmental Writing
description:
Advanced instruction in writing and practice in effective styles of
communication in the fields of environmental study, policy, or advocacy.
prereq: UWP 001 or ENL 003; Or the equivalent and upper division standing.

name: Human Rights and Gender
description:
Gender and sexuality in the context of human rights. Topics include women's
participation in the public sphere, the right to change gender, the right for
family privacy, and the right to marriage.

name: Water, Power, Society
description:
Water resources issues. How water has been used to gain and wield socio-
political power. Water resources development in California related to current
and future sustainability of water quantity and quality. Roles of science and
policy in solving water problems.

name: Technical Writing
description:
Communicating effectively about technology and other technical subjects to
varied audiences for varied purposes. Suitable for students entering
professions that require communicating technical information to subject matter
experts, managers, technicians, and non-specialists.

name: Calif & Latin America
description:
Interdisciplinary survey on the relationship between California and Latin
America (1500s-present). Latin American representations of California and
Californian representations of Latin America, as well as borderlands texts,
with a special focus on Mexican-American perspectives. Conducted in Spanish.

name: Advancd Multiling Wrtng
description:

The art of character animation in three dimensional computer animation.

technical and practical skills.

name: Wildl Ecol Conserve

Development of advanced level writing skills, with emphasis on how to write
